intro: Carum piovanii, commonly known as the Piovanii caraway, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, spicy aroma. Carum piovanii is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
